page.title: 18Religion in Whiston Village
page.content: In our village there is one church which was started in 1909 and was finished in 1910. 500 tonnes of stone was used for it, which came from the old copper works that was in the village. Also farmers lent horses and carts for moving stone and people helped when they had spare time. In the village is a school which was built in 1872, and before the church was actually built people used part of the school as a chancel. This chancel was built in 1891 so that meant that the school could be used as a church on Sundays. Over the other side of the road from the church is a chapel which was built in 1907 of brick, to replace a small stone chapel opposite.
